column4: what could be the problem If I just simply login and then the Gnome Desktop bar wont load and I only see my mouse and background. I can't also acces to the virtual consoles with "ctrl+alt+f's"
Answer......
do you know another user account? can you log into Gnome with it?
actually I just installed it to that PC so no
as I said virtual consoles wont work :<
just checking you knew how to access them
ok, so before you login
do what?
create a new user on the system from the CLI and then try logging in with it
but it sounds as if X is locking your system solid
also look at /var/log/Xorg.0.log for evidence of problems
useradd and adduser both seem to be there - you'll need to use sudo of course
yes it sounds like X is dying really badly - did you look at /var/log/Xorg.0.log ?
also, what changed since your system was working last?
nope
my system hasn't been working
Was it a fresh install to a freshly-formatted partition?
I splitted my HDD in two partions one was my for my XP install 30GB and one for ubuntu 10GB
- what sort of vid car you got?
do you know how to switch to our private channel? (query) ?
what IRC prog u using ?
